snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany told lawmakers the country could not prop up the faltering euro zone.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel tells German lawmakers that the country cannot prop up the faltering euro zone even as Europe's currency union inches ever closer to brink of collapse; firm stance leaves many wondering who will help keep the euro zone from falling apart if the Continent's largest economy cannot--or will not.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and PAUL GEITNER
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Paul Geitner from Brussels. Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin, and David Jolly from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany told lawmakers the country could not prop up the faltering euro zone.

headline.seo: Merkel Stresses Limits to Germany’s Ability to Rescue Euro Zone
headline.main: Merkel Stresses Limits to Germany’s Strength
headline.print_headline: Merkel Stresses Limits to Germany’s Ability to Rescue Euro Zone
